module.name: Calendar
module.short: Classes and types used to implement TCalendar, a graphic control allowing selection of a date from a calendar display.

descr.p: calendar.pp contains classes and types used to implement TCalendar, a graphic control allowing selection of a date from a calendar display. It is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).
The following components are added to the Lazarus IDE component palette:
Misc Tab

element.name: TDisplaySetting
element.short: Enumerated type with values that control display settings in TCalendar.

descr.p: TDisplaySetting is an enumerated type with values that control display settings in TCalendar. Values from TDisplaySetting are stored in the TDisplaySettings type.
descr.remark: The value dsStartMonday has been removed in LCL version 2.2 or higher.

element.name: TDisplaySetting.dsShowHeadings
element.short: Displays a month/year heading.

element.name: TDisplaySetting.dsShowDayNames
element.short: Displays day names.

element.name: TDisplaySetting.dsNoMonthChange
element.short: Prevents changing the current month.

element.name: TDisplaySetting.dsShowWeekNumbers
element.short: Displays week numbers.

element.name: TDisplaySettings
element.short: Set type for TDisplaySetting values.

descr.p: TDisplaySettings is a set type used to store enumerations values from TDisplaySetting. It is the type used for the DisplaySettings property in TCustomCalendar.

element.name: DefaultDisplaySettings
element.short: Default display settings used in TCalendar.

descr.p: DefaultDisplaySettings is a constant with the default display settings used in TCalendar. DefaultDisplaySettings contains the following values:

element.name: TCalendarPart
element.short: Indicates where a mouse click occurred in a calendar control.

descr.p: TCalendarPart is an enumerated type with values that indicate where a mouse click occurred in a calendar control. TCalendarPart is used to implement the TCustomCalendar.HitTest method.

element.name: TCalendarPart.cpNoWhere
element.short: Mouse click cannot be applied to the control; no handle available.

element.name: TCalendarPart.cpDate
element.short: Mouse click occurred on a date in the calendar control.

element.name: TCalendarPart.cpWeekNumber
element.short: Mouse click occurred on a week number in the calendar control.

element.name: TCalendarPart.cpTitle
element.short: Mouse click occurred on a day heading in the calendar control.

element.name: TCalendarPart.cpTitleBtn
element.short: Mouse click occurred on a navigation button in a calendar control.

element.name: TCalendarPart.cpTitleMonth
element.short: Mouse click occurred on the month name heading in the calendar control.

element.name: TCalendarPart.cpTitleYear
element.short: Mouse click occurred on the year number heading in the calendar control.

element.name: TCalendarView
element.short: Defines the view for a calendar.

descr.p: TCalendarView is an enumeration type with values that define the view for a calendar control. TCalendarView makes it possible to set the calendar view introduced in Windows Vista or later. In other widgetsets, as well as in older versions of Windows, a calendar has only a standard "month view" grid with days representing a month. TCalendarView is used to implement the TCustomCalendar.GetCalendarView method.

element.name: TCalendarView.cvMonth
element.short: Grid has days for one month.

element.name: TCalendarView.cvYear
element.short: Grid has months in one year.

element.name: TCalendarView.cvDecade
element.short: Grid has years from one decade.

element.name: TCalendarView.cvCentury
element.short: Grid has decades for one century.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek
element.short: Represents days of the week used in TCalendar.

descr.p: TCalDayOfWeek is an enumerated type with values which represent the day used as the first day of the week in TCustomCalendar and descendants.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek.dowMonday
element.short: Represents Monday.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek.dowTuesday
element.short: Represents Tuesday.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek.dowWednesday
element.short: Represents Wednesday.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek.dowThursday
element.short: Represents Thursday.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek.dowFriday
element.short: Represents Friday.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek.dowSaturday
element.short: Represents Saturday.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek.dowSunday
element.short: Represents Sunday.

element.name: TCalDayOfWeek.dowDefault
element.short: Use the default day of the week setting for the platform for the first day of the week. Not compatible with the value used in Delphi (dowLocaleDefault).

element.name: EInvalidDate
element.short: EInvalidDate is an exception raised for an invalid date.

descr.p: EInvalidDate is an exception raised when a invalid date is selected in a calendar control.

element.name: TCustomCalendar
element.short: TCustomCalendar - base class for TCalendar.

descr.p: TCustomCalendar is the base class for TCalendar, a graphic control for selecting a date.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetDateTime
element.short: Gets the value for the DateTime property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetDateTime.Result
element.short: Value for the DateTime property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.SetDateTime
element.short: Sets the value for the DateTime property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.SetDateTime.AValue
element.short: New value for the DateTime property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetProps
element.short: Gets values for properties in the calendar control.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.SetProps
element.short: Sets values for properties in the calendar control.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetDisplaySettings
element.short: Gets the value for the DisplaySettings property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetDisplaySettings.Result
element.short: Value for the DisplaySettings property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.SetDisplaySettings
element.short: Sets the value for the DisplaySettings property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.SetDisplaySettings.AValue
element.short: New value for the DisplaySettings property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetDate
element.short: Gets the value for the Date property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetDate.Result
element.short: Value for the Date property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.SetDate
element.short: Sets the value for the Date property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.SetDate.AValue
element.short: New value for the Date property.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.LMChanged
element.short: LMChanged - LCL Message method to deal with changes in the control.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.LMMonthChanged
element.short: LMMonthChanged - LCL Message method for change in Month.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.LMYearChanged
element.short: LMYearChanged - LCL Message method for change in Year.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.LMDayChanged
element.short: LMDayChanged - LCL Message method for change in Day.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomCalendar.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TCustomCalendar. Create calls the inherited Create method, and sets the style, initial bounds, and display settings for the calendar. Create sets the default date and time value to Now.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.HitTest
element.short: Indicates where a mouse click occurred in the calendar control.

descr.p: HitTest is a TCalendarPart function that indicates where a mouse click occurred in the calendar control. The return value indicates the part of the control clicked, or cpNoWhere when the handle has not been allocated for the control. HitTest ensures that the widget-set specific HitTest method is called.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.HitTest.APoint
element.short: Coordinates where the mouse click occurred.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetCalendarView
element.short: Gets the current view for the Calendar.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.GetCalendarView.Result
element.short: Current view for the Calendar.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.Date
element.short: Date is a string representation of the DateTime value.

descr.p: Date is a String property that represents the value in DateTime as a string data type. Reading the value in Date calls the GetProps method to get the current value for DateTime, and converts it to its string representation. Setting the value in Date calls the SetProps method to store the new value for both Date and DateTime.

errors.p: Raises an EInvalidDate exception when Date contains an invalid date value.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.DateTime
element.short: Native data type used for a date in the calendar control.

descr.p: DateTime is a TDateTime property that contains the native data type used for a date in the calendar control. Reading the value in DateTime calls the GetProps method to get the current values for Date and DateTime. Setting the value in DateTime calls SetProps to update the values in Date and DateTime.

For the Windows environment, the CalendarMinDate and CalendarMaxDate member variables are updated to ensure that date values are in an acceptable date/time value range. An EInvalidDate exception is raised if the value is not a valid date/time for the platform.
descr.remark: The calendar control does not use the time portion of the TDateTime data type. The time value is not significant unless a specified value is not valid for the date/time data type.

errors.p: EInvalidDate exception is raised if the value is not a valid date/time for the platform; raised with the message rsInvalidDateRangeHint.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.DisplaySettings
element.short: DisplaySettings contains options which control the appearance of the calendar.

descr.p: DisplaySettings contains options which control the appearance of the calendar. DisplaySettings is a set type which contains zero or more TDisplaySetting values, including:
descr.remark: The value dsStartMonday is no longer available in LCL version 2.2 or higher. It has been replaced by the FirstDayOfWeek property on platforms where the capability is supported (Win32, QT, QT5). This is Delphi compatible, and allows any day of the week to be used as the first day of the week.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.FirstDayOfWeek
element.short: Indicates the day of the week displayed as the first column in the calendar grid.

descr.p: FirstDayOfWeek is a TCalDayOfWeek property which indicates the day used as the first day of the week. It contains a value from the TCalDayOfWeek enumeration, and determines the order of the cells displayed in the calendar grid. The default value is dowDefault, and indicates the default value provided by the platform or operating system is used.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for any change in Calendar.

descr.p: OnChange is a TNotifyEvent property that represents the event handler signalled when the date/time value for the control has changed. OnChange is signalled from the LMChanged, LMDayChanged, LMMonthChanged, and LMYearChanged methods. Applications should assign a procedure to the event handle to respond to the message notification.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.OnDayChanged
element.short: OnDayChanged - event handler for a change in Day selected.

descr.p: OnDayChanged is a TNotifyEvent property that represents the event handler signalled when the day number in the date/time value for the control has changed. OnDayChanged is signalled from the LMDayChanged method. Applications should assign a procedure to the event handler to respond to the message notification.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.OnMonthChanged
element.short: OnMonthChanged - event handler for a change in month selected.

descr.p: OnMonthChanged is a TNotifyEvent property that represents the event handler signalled when the month in the date/time value for the control has changed. OnMonthChanged is signalled from the LMMonthChanged method. Applications should assign a procedure to the event handler to respond to the message notification.

element.name: TCustomCalendar.OnYearChanged
element.short: OnYearChanged - event handler for a change in the year selected.

descr.p: OnYearChanged is a TNotifyEvent property that represents the event handler signalled when the year in the date/time value for the control has changed. OnMonthChanged is signalled from the LMYearChanged method. Applications should assign a procedure to the event handler to respond to the message notification.

element.name: TCalendar
element.short: TCalendar allows selection of a date from a calendar display.

descr.p: TCalendar is a graphic control allowing the user to select a date from a calendar display.

element.name: Register
element.short: Registers components for use in the Lazarus IDE.

descr.p: Register is the procedure used to register components for use in the Lazarus IDE. The following components are added to the Lazarus IDE component palette:
Misc Tab
